metadata.title: PM Line Hydrography Data of the Sea of Japan by Maizuru Marine Observatory

creators.name: Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA), Maizuru Marine Observatory

metadata.description:
Maizuru Marine Observatory of the Japan Meteorological Agency has conducted routine oceanographic research cruises along the PM line for more than 30 years.  PM line oceanographic data set were collected from R.V. Seifu-Maru II-II Ship Observation.  The PM line is based on data taken at three stations; PM4, PM5, and PM6.  Hydrographic data include water temperature and salinity, DO, pH, PH4, NO3, NO2, Chl-a, pheopigment from sample depth of 0 to up to near bottom.  The samples were collected 4 times/year.  Nansen cast or CTD cast with Niskin bottle was used.  

[ Reference: PICES Scientific Report No. 18 2001, Proceedings of the PICES/CoML/IPRC Workshop on "Impact of Climate Variability on Observation and Prediction of Ecosystem and Biodiversity Changes in the North Pacific", http://www.pices.int/publications/scientific_reports/Report18/default.aspx. ]
metadata.notes:
Purpose: To study the decadal-scale ecosystem change at three of the PM stations located in the offshore Tsushima Current area.

Status: In Progress

Maintenance frequency: Quarterly

Access constraints: None

Use constraints: Contact Source.
